person.persName: Ota H. Ward, Sr. (Breathitt County, Kentucky, postmaster and saddler.)

body.p: Breathitt County, Kentucky, postmaster, saddler, and militia officer. Virginia native. Married to Susan Ward. Father of Martha Ward, Ota H. Ward, Jr., William S. Ward, Mary D. Ward, Julia O. Ward, and Margaret C. Ward. Married to Mary Jane Vance Ward. Resident of Washington County, Virginia, in 1840. Farmer in Washington County in 1850. Postmaster for Hayter's Gap in Washington County from May 1, 1851, to December 15, 1852. Postmaster for Lost Creek in Breathitt County, Kentucky, from September 5, 1854, to June 15, 1859. Saddler in Breathitt County in 1860. Commissioned in the Breathitt County enrolled militia as a colonel on December 19, 1860.
